title: Action-Observation and Motor Imagery (AOMI) Instructional Design for Motor Skill Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental exercise mechanics and teaching methodologies, along with basic smartphone utilization
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service and in-service teachers to enhance competency in teaching motor skills, consisting of twice-weekly face-to-face classes (3 hours) + mobile learning (5 hours/week), including smartphone-based video viewing and practical assignments

learning_goals: Learners can accurately describe three core movements of motor skills using the AOMI technique within four weeks
Learners reduce technical error rates by 20% or more when applying AOMI training in the third practical evaluation
Learners achieve a 15% or greater score improvement in pre-post self-efficacy surveys

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Video Materials (5 First-Person/Third-Person Perspectives Each)
Mobile Learning Management Platform (for Assignment Submission)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
